Ghost is a word game played by two players. The goal is to never form a complete word.
 
One of the players begins the game by naming any letter of the alphabet. Then the players continue adding letters with the aim avoiding being the one to complete a word. Each fragment must be the beginning of an actual word. The player who completes a word (longer than three letters) loses the round and gets a "letter" from the word "GHOST". When a player adds a letter to the fragment and no word can be made of it anymore, that player loses the round and a another letter from GHOST is added to his set of letters. When one of the players completes the word "GHOST" that player loses the game.
 
The player whose turn it is may - instead of adding a letter - challenge the previous player to prove that the current fragment is actually the beginning of a word. If the challenged player can name such a word, the challenger loses the round; otherwise the challenged player loses the round. If a player bluffs, or completes a word without other players noticing, then play continues. When a round ends, play generally passes to the left.
